title: No matter what I set the `blockGasLimit` and `gas` to my contract won't deploy - error: "Transaction run out of gas"
body:
Firstly thank you for this tool, I started using it on my other two projects a few moths ago, really awesome stuff :)

I am trying to switch the wildcards.world smart contracts to use buidler while testing our next version; but I'm running into the issue I'll describe below. I've put everything in a branch so it should be very easy to reproduce on your side. It is (from what I can see, unless I'm missing something) a pretty major bug, as I am unable to use buidler until this is worked out.

The most similar issue I could find is this https://github.com/nomiclabs/buidler/issues/9 but it would appear Buidler has changed a lot since then!

# Background:

The wildcards contracts used to and still do use truffle + ganache.

When I switched to buidler I started getting strange errors where the contract would start to refuse to deploy (but deploy completely fine on ganache with the same gas limit). I have with lots of trial and error gotten the contract to a state where commenting out/or in a single line changes if it can deploy or not!

# How to reproduce:

`git clone -b js/working-buidler https://github.com/wildcards-world/contracts.git`
`cd contracts`
`yarn`

Run the buidler tests (that work):
`yarn run test -- ./test/test_gas_limit_steward_deploy.js`
Run the ganach/truffle tests for comparison:
 - Run ganache in a separate terminal with `ganache-cli -l 95000000 ` (Yes, the block gas limit is set about 10x not really part of the issue, just made it comfortably high to eliminade doubt).
- `truffle test --network test ./test/test_gas_limit_steward_deploy.js`

_all the above should pass without no issues - it is the 'control' in this experiment. It should print that "Deploying the steward contract used: 5332541"_

Then go to line 86 and 89-92 of `./contracts/WildcardSteward_v2.sol` then comment and comment those two lines respectively:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6032276/82200485-5ba76180-98ff-11ea-8cbd-263c762b9874.png)


Then run the two tests for buidler and truffle/ganache again. This time buidler will say "Transaction run out of gas" and truffle/ganache will work as expected.

The transaction would of course use more gas; but I've sepcifically set the blockGasLimit and gas to be extremely high. So that isn't the issue.

`buidler.config.js`:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6032276/82154934-834fe880-9871-11ea-83a5-595e98660d69.png)

`./test/test_gas_limit_steward_deploy.js`:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6032276/82154949-9b276c80-9871-11ea-8e6f-eb02f5914037.png)

Those specific lines aren't particularly imortant; simply adding a bit more code causes this issue.

Thank you. Please tell me if there are any other things I can help with.

Closing this. There is a limit in the size contract bytecode can be. We were exceeding this limit.

https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-170.md

The reason this worked differently for truffle and for buidler is that truffle was running the optimiser. When I added the optimiser to buidler it reduced the contract bytecode size, and it worked fine :)
